org.phantomapi.async

Class MultithreadedQueueExecutor<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.phantomapi.async.MultithreadedQueueExecutor<T>
  • Type Parameters:
    T - the object type for the queue. Ensure it implements the equals method.

    public abstract class MultithreadedQueueExecutor<T>
extends Object
    Create a multithreaded queue executor. This allows you to pile in objects and process each one just like an executive iterator, except this allows multiple or just one async thread working on the queue at once. Ensure that the object T implements the equals method
    Author:
    cyberpwn

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      MultithreadedQueueExecutor(int maxThreads)
      Create a multithreaded queued executor with the desired max threads

    • Constructor Detail

      • MultithreadedQueueExecutor

        public MultithreadedQueueExecutor(int maxThreads)
        Create a multithreaded queued executor with the desired max threads
        Parameters:
        maxThreads - the max threads. This can be changed at anytime.

    • Method Detail

      • onProcess

        public abstract void onProcess(T t)
        This is called async. Any sync invocations should be handled as this is called async
        Parameters:
        t - the object being processed

      • queue

        public void queue(T t)
        Queue an object for processing. This method forces sync appending to the queue. If you queue this async, a sync task will be queued to queue your object. safe to be called async or sync
        Parameters:
        t - the object to queue for multithreaded processing

      • dispatch

        public void dispatch()
        This method dispatches new threads to work on objects within the queue. This object does not automatically tick itself. Tick this at the desired interval to make it actually process the objects in the queue safe to be called async or sync

      • dispatchThread

        public void dispatchThread(T t)
        Dispatches a thread into the pool with the given object to work with safe to be called async or sync
        Parameters:
        t - the object

      • getQueue

        public GList<T> getQueue()
        Get the queue ENFORCES SYNC
        Returns:
        the queued objects to be processed

      • getActive

        public GList<T> getActive()
        Get the active queue ENFORCES SYNC
        Returns:
        the active objects being processed

      • getMaxThreads

        public int getMaxThreads()
        Get the max threads
        Returns:
        the max threads

      • setMaxThreads

        public void setMaxThreads(int maxThreads)
        Set the max threads. If there are threads currently working at this time, once they finish the new dispatched threads will follow the updated max. ENFORCES SYNC
        Parameters:
        maxThreads - the new max threads count.

      • getActiveThreads

        public int getActiveThreads()
        Get the active queue size ENFORCES SYNC
        Returns:
        the size of active objects being processed

      • clearQueue

        public void clearQueue()
        Clear the queue. Async calls will be scheduled to be invoked sync
